meanings.definition: The quality or state of being improbable.
meanings.sent1: The improvabilities of winning the lottery are very low.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't believe the improvabilities of finding her lost ring in the sand.
meanings.sent3: Despite the improvabilities, he decided to try his luck at the talent show.
meanings.sent4: The improvabilities of a snowstorm in July seemed more likely than her showing up on time.
meanings.sent5: The improvabilities of a talking dog captured everyone's attention at the circus.

meanings.definition: The improbability of something happening or being true.
meanings.sent1: The improvabilities of aliens visiting Earth are a popular topic in science fiction.
meanings.sent2: Considering the improvabilities, she still held onto hope for a miracle.
meanings.sent3: The improvabilities of a penguin flying made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The improvabilities of a unicorn existing are as likely as finding a pot of gold at the end of a rainbow.
meanings.sent5: The improvabilities of time travel fascinated the young scientist.
